movieReview: Much more sad than I expected, in an appropriate way. Humanized Tonya in a way I don't think has ever happened.
Solid roc dock about a band I knew too little about.
Daniel Day-Lewis' "final" performance is a subtler one than we've seen in the past, but no less extraordinary. This is a surprising, wonderful film.

Solid Spielberg; Opening Vietnam scene was hard to follow, and the last few scenes of the movie were Spielberg schmaltz turned up to 11, but the rest of the movie was very good. Meryl Streep killed it.
A sweet film.
There were moments in this film. There were some amazing performances. But it was excruciatingly drawn out. I'm sure it was intentional, but that didn't help me enjoy it.
This was a pretty solid biopic, which is not my favorite genre.... Though the fact that it was about funny people from a director and actors I love definitely helped.
Powerful and moving
A look into a band that never made it...

Herzog is amazing, especially his documentary work, and this is no exception. His ability to find interesting 'characters' and situations is unparalleled, and he is easily the best at filming beautiful landscapes.
Improbably, I hadn't seen this movie until now. It was a piece of garbage. I was rooting for the asteroid.
Guhhhhhh........... So fucking on the nose.
Wow, this was worse than I remembered. Seeing it in 35mm w/ the 3D scenes intact on the big screen was special, though.
Fuck Kobe Bryant
This was my favorite of the Oscar animated shorts.. Beautiful and funny.
Another sacchrine short from Pixar.
This was a great short, and definitely jived with my organization compulsion.
A nice short, an adaptation of Roald Dahl's short reimagining of existing fairy tales..
Nice little short, felt a bit like Aardman meets Brothers Quay.
Funny short.
Meh.
Pretty good, better than I remembered, maybe I was just in a cruddy mood when I first saw it.
Enjoyable.... Felt a little long, but it was a nice story.
Ostensibly an all dog found-footage remake of The Holy Mountain. 'Nuff Said.
Very good. Still suffered from the "Bad Guy and Good Guy have the same powers" comic trope, but still, quite good.
An 'aight adaptation of what I would consider an unfilmable book, but they changed so much it only had a vague correlation with the book anyway. Not great, not bad, just ok.
Possibly the best EiT joint to date...
movieTitle: Everything is Terrible! presents: The Great Satan

movieReview: This movie is fuckin' great.
A perfectly fine biography, but likely didn't need to be 90m OR it needed to go into more detail about her life (both during her career and afterwards).
An interesting look into the creation of The Last Jedi.... A little less sycophantic than the doc that came with The Force Awakens, but still a little too polished for my taste.
This was a nanoblack comedy. Very good, but not every audience is gonna like it.

Even though this was what the original intent of the kickstarter project was all about, now it's a 15 minute short borne out of the Kip Weeks' doc... Creation can be messy, and what you start with isn't always what you end up with.

This was an interesting profile of a man who had a taste of his dream and is trying to reclaim it.... I didn't know Kip Weeks at all and haven't actually seen The Strangers, but he's a compelling character and his story was interesting
A nice little horror short by Izzy Lee...
I fell in love with RIVERS AND TIDES, and while I didn't know I wanted a followup, it was wonderful.
movieTitle: Leaning Into the Wind: Andy Goldsworthy

movieReview: Amazingly I had never seen this movie. It's pretty 'aight, but I have no idea how Hans Zimmer was able to score another film after this one. It is fucking horrendous.
The story of an improbable failure despite tons of amazing talent. Fascinating.
A wonderful birthday present to myself.
Corinna and I put this on as just something to kill a few minutes as we got ready for bed. We watched the whole thing.
I have so much fondness for Garry Shandling. I loved It's Garry Shandling's Show as a kid, and he's always made me laugh so much. This was a great documentary.
movieTitle: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling

movieReview: Memberberries: The Movie was aight.
Quite good. Thought the score was stellar and was not surprised to see it was Jonny Greenwood. Great performance by Joachim.
Such an important part of my early childhood, whether it was Wrestling or The Princess Bride... This was a very nice profile of him.
I really enjoyed this one. Spooky and scary.
Finally got around to seeing this short from IFFBoston a few years ago. Nice, short profile of a quirky field filled with heads.
Funny, sweet and anxious. Nowhere near as frenetic as I'd have expected from Bo Burnham. Very good.

Good, but felt long. Real-life interview segments felt a bit unnecessary. Too many 'staring into the camera, thinking' shots. Still an interesting not-documentary that could have easily been called a documentary.
Fun doc covering an unbelievable story.
movieTitle: White Tide: The Legend of Culebra

movieReview: Another great picture from Debra Granik. The lead actress, Thomasin McKenzie puts in a great performance, and Ben Foster dials it back a bit for a subtler turn than usual.
A fine documentary on a nerdy subject. Goes into more detail than I would have expected.
A nice profile of some classic Americana. Stayed pretty tight and focused. Really enjoyed it.
Started off strong, but after the first 20m completely lost it's way.
Very good. Compelling story that keeps on taking unexpected turns.
A little long, but the subjects kept it moving. Sagged in the middle, otherwise a solid music doc.
Fine, but I feel like this territory has been well covered.
Guhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh
"That Fighting Couple You Are Friends With Which Thinks They Love Each Other": The Movie. That said, it was well done.
Eh, didn't really dig this one. It was fine, but meh.
This was well made, though I feel like I've seen it before.
This made me laugh out loud several times. Very good.
Each of the three segments felt a little long, but interesting subjects and subject matter.

I liked this more than I expected. Was surprised for it to mostly focus on Montana and give the detail to stories I only read headlines about. Not your usual "doom and gloom we're fucked" political doc.
This was fantastic. Well paced exciting, moving... Was a tad nervous about the use of verse in the film, but it felt natural in almost every use. Highly recommended.
Any narrative that features musicians writing and performing strikes fear into my heart, but this was a sweet film about a father and daughter which avoided many of the groany tropes.

A fun, "save the X" drama with some funny moments and a very defined style. An expansion of a short I saw at last year's IFFBoston, I was concerned if it would expand to a feature, but my fears were mostly unfounded.. Felt a tad stretched at moments, but overall a minor criticism from me.
movieTitle: When Jeff Tried to Save the World

movieReview: Had more endings than RETURN OF THE KING.

Some real laugh out loud moments (including one of my favorite lines of the year so far) and surprises. Based on the still image alone I was expecting this to be a groaner (I don't read up on the festival movies that don't play opposed to anything), but it was really fun.
It was fine. Something about knowing that there really are no stakes, nobody important is going to die, and that there are infinite sequels inbound made it all feel hollow.
This movie only had me crying for 62 percent of it's runtime.
Meh... Wasn't a huge fan of the original, and this is diminishing returns.... Waaaaaayyyyy too long.
Better than I expected.... Good rental.
Gilbert Gottfried is one of my favorite comics, and it was fascinating to see him as a real person.
I love stories about people beating game shows... This could have been a tad shorter, but it was overall good.
movieTitle: Perfect Bid: The Contestant Who Knew Too Much

movieReview: Kevin Smith might not have aged well as a director, but he can still tell a funny story.
A surprising movie that the less you know about the better.
Mulaney doesn't always work for me, but this special was pretty good.
movieTitle: John Mulaney: Kid Gorgeous at Radio City

movieReview: It was OK. I didn't seem to love DP1 as much as everyone else, but it was funny enough. This was also funny, but definitely felt pretty retread-y. I'm not sure they have anywhere else to go with this schtick.
A perfectly fine Star War. Fun, funny, and mostly exciting.
It had been a long time since I had seen this film, and possibly the first time in a theatre. The 70mm "unrestored" print is gorgeous, and I'm glad I saw it in the best possible circumstances.
This movie was fucking terrible. Boring, long and stupid.
Pretty but meh.
Booooooooooooring
Great profile of one of the most important musicians of the past 100 years.
Hitchcock firing on all cylinders... This is a very good movie, suspenseful yet funny.
movieTitle: The Man Who Knew Too Much

movieReview: A relatively small film that was a nice palate cleanser after the overall dour, huge vibe of recent Marvel.
First half was stupid and boring. Second half was stupid.
A fine film, but a bit boring at times.
movieTitle: All the Money in the World

movieReview: I love these two, so I wanted to love this a bunch, but it was only OK.
movieTitle: Nick Offerman & Megan Mullally: Summer of 69: No Apostrophe

movieReview: I'm not that familiar with Cameron, but after hearing her on a podcast and enjoying the discussion, I watched this special. Pretty funny treatment of serious subjects.
Saw this at the Aquarium IMAX. Perfectly fine.
Pretty good! A bit too Wes Anderson at times, but well paced and scripted.
I didn't realize how much I needed a solid action movie.
Jerry created a fun, interesting standup/memoir special... Telling stories about getting started in comedy combined with many jokes from his early days...
I liked this better the 2nd time around, but it's still kinda meh.... It's like the same story over and over again (Sentimentality loses the battle).
Lots of good skating, great cast, and engaging story. There were a few shots that could have brought it down to a more appropriate 90m, but that's a relatively minor complaint.
A fascinating documentary looking into the world of doping.
Pretty boring and slow. There was no real conflict; nothing went wrong with the plan, save the "No Signal" and the magnet thing, but even those were resolved basically immediately.
This man is a house of contradiction cards. He is likely also mentally ill.
I feel like the trailer sold this as more of a comedy than it was, but I still thought it was pretty good.
Oofa goofa.... This wasn't /horrible/ but it also wasn't any good. Poor attempt at trying to weave a story into Jackass stunts... This time it worked way worse than Bad Grandpa
Guhhhhhhhhhh. Way too long and turned to complete garbage at the end.

Better than I expected, a solid little mystery that isn't "about the gimmick" as much as you'd expect. But the "everything thru webcams, etc" gimmick were some of the best renditions of tech I've seen in a long time.
Better than I remembered, but still ultimately disposable.
Beautiful, but didn't quite feel like a movie... The scenes didn't really have any connective tissue, and it dragged at times.
Still such a fantastic film. I really think the only flaw I find in it is the "beginning at the end" framing device that I'm so tired of.
This is a fantastic film. And even though it is 3+ hours long it doesn't feel it. Possibly Spike Lee's finest.
Not bad but depressing as fuck.
Pretty good, a little long but what isn't these days... Lady Gaga did a great job.
Boy howdy was this a clunker. Perfect for MST3K.
What a stinker. No life, no emotion, basically a rehash of several of the prior films... Nothing new... Too long... Glad I didn't pay to see it.

This movie is plainly too long. I was dozing off several times during the first half. The second half was more engaging but I was still frustrated at the pacing of the film overall. There is no reality where this story is best served by a runtime of nearly 2.5 hours.
Not sure there was actually enough material here to support 1h45m, but Kane is an interesting subject and has an interesting story.
movieTitle: To Hell and Back: The Kane Hodder Story

movieReview: Did a litle self-refresher before seeing the new sequel. Such a great movie. Soundtrack is infectous.
Pretty fun, surprised me at times... Had some dumb moments, and could have shed about 5-10m, but given how low my expectations were, it was pretty good.
Very powerful, engaging and moving.

This was good! As a Queen guy, they played it a bit fast and loose with the truth, but it's a biopic so whatcha gonna do. It was pretty sanitized, but whatever. I don't understand the harsh criticism of this movie, it was pretty solid for a music biopic.
A fascinating look at a Master's unfinished work which is now finished.
movieTitle: They'll Love Me When I'm Dead

movieReview: A brief look into Danny Brown's creative process... Long shelved by Apple Music, it finally got a release.
movieTitle: Danny Brown Live at the Majestic

movieReview: Pretty meh
I had never seen this, but my friend Dan hyped it pretty hard. It was pretty good, though not what I expected.
So glad to have MST3K back!
Pretty good action movie. This time I started a stopwatch at the 15m countdown.... More like 22m :)
Man, this movie was a real piece of shit, but MST3K made it bearable....
A fantastic profile of a curious man who gave up his acting career to study under and assist Stanley Kubrick.
Gotta be honest, this film is more fun than good. The live performance of the soundtrack by Goblin was a very fun experience.
This movie, unlike Atlantic Rim, was a great MST3K pick. Just the right level of bad, and lots of room for riffing.
To be honest, I barely remembered anything from the first one. I expect this will be equally forgettable. But it was entertaining enough, if not long.
A great MST3K choice. Pretty darned bad film saved by some great riffing.
A solid little sci-fi/western. Not amazing, but enjoyable
We needed something light tonight and this always fits the bill... It's really a masterpiece.
Needed something familiar and fun on the day we lost Queenie. Star Wars was an obvious go-to.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope

movieReview: Needed something familiar and fun on the day we lost Queenie. Star Wars was an obvious go-to.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

movieReview: We started this on Monday (along with the rest of the OT) but finished it the next day.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi

movieReview: This was a documentary on the cultural impact of the game Half-Life and its sequels. I was surprised it was as engaging as it was given the lack of Valve involvement, but it was quite well made.
This was OK, but I was overall disappointed relative to how excited I got based on the people making the film. It let me down in several directions.
Continuing our mental-health binge of Star Wars, we watched The Force Awakens. It's still so much fun.
Finishing (?) our Star Wars binge with what may be the greatest Star Wars film in the series, really only competing with Empire....
This is pretty not good. So many boring parts in it; I found myself playing with my phone often.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace

movieReview: This was better than Ep1, but still had some terrible parts.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones

movieReview: I remembered this being better than it was. There were some really draggy scenes and overall it felt waaaaay too fanservice-y.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith

movieReview: Meh... I was pretty excited to see this but I found it downright boring at times and nowhere near as funny as the trailer made it seem.
Still unnecessary and visually flat, but just entertaining enough.
This was very good, but a bit too dark for a Christmas Vacation watch.... lol
Only seems fitting to watch this while visiting my parents in my homeland.
A slow but interesting history of the forces that brought the troupe together.
movieTitle: Monty Python: Before the Flying Circus

movieReview: The first film in our Christmas Eve marathon, a classic. Still great as always.
The second film in our Marathon, this one never gets old. I could really watch it any time of year, to be honest.
The final movie in our xmas eve marathon, this one is always a part of it and this year was it's 30th anniversary. What a fantastic film.
Yes, I just watched this a week or two ago. But we gave Corinna's stepdad the disc for xmas and you don't have to twist my arm to watch a Star Wars flick at any given time.
It was fine. I don't understand all of the hype.
I hadn't seen this since it was first released on video in '04. It's quite good, better than I remembered.
movieTitle: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
